summary: Build a playful, pink-themed Valentine’s proposal website personalized for Astha, featuring a fun interaction flow that only allows accepting the proposal (no deny option).
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Pink heart-pattern background with subtle gradients and sparkles (valentine-bg.dim_1920x1080.png)
- Cute cartoon heart character holding a small sign (heart-mascot.dim_800x800.png)
- Set of 6 small playful Valentine stickers (hearts, roses, candies) on transparent background (valentine-stickers.dim_1024x1024.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine proposal website personalized for the name “Astha”, with all user-facing text in English and a consistently pink, playful, fun visual style (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, and backgrounds).

Implement a proposal interaction flow that provides no effective way to deny the proposal: the UX must lead to a single successful outcome (“Yes”), and any attempted “No”/dismiss/close actions (if present) must not result in a denial state.

Add a celebratory “Yes” success experience: a cute animation (e.g., hearts/confetti), a short romantic confirmation message, and an optional small follow-up prompt (e.g., “Pick our date idea”) that stays within the Yes-only flow (no rejection branches).

Add backend persistence to record when the proposal is accepted (timestamp + optional client-provided short note), and expose a query to retrieve the latest acceptance record (or total accept count) for display on the success screen.
Use generated static image assets to enhance the playful Valentine theme (background/hero illustration/stickers), and render them from frontend static assets (do not serve images via the backend).
